profileText: A Representative from Minnesota; born in Mamre Township, Kandiyohi County, Minn., September 11, 1930; attended the public schools and graduated from Willmar High School in 1948; engaged in farming, 1948-1955; employed as an insurance representative, 1955-1962; active in the Democrat-Farmer-Labor Party, 1952-1962, serving as district chairman for four years; delegate to Democratic National Conventions, 1960, 1964, and 1968; elected as a Democrat to the Eighty-eighth and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 1963-January 3, 1967); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1966 to the Ninetieth Congress; assistant in charge of defense mobilization planning to Secretary of Agriculture Orville L. Freeman, 1967; account executive with Kelley and Morey investment company; member, Minnesota State senate, 1969-1976; named Lieutenant Governor in 1976 and served from December 29, 1976, to January 3, 1979; is a resident of Willmar, Minn.

researchRecord.name: In the Minnesota Office of the Lieutenant Governor Records, 1972-1978, 2 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The files of Alec Gehard Olson while he was Lieutenant Governor of Minnesota include correspondence and miscellany in alphabetical subject files, photocopies of newspaper clippings that document Alec Olson's political career, constituent correspondence and requests, invitations, and speech files. The subject files pertain to a variety of fiscal and policy matters, particularly state/federal relations, taxation, health and social services, environmental issues and projects especially in Kandiyohi County, and economic development. Several files contain materials dating from 1972-1976, when Alec Olson served in the state senate representing Kandiyohi County (Spicer). There are also some minutes, grant data, and miscellany of the Governor's Rural Development Council (1974-1978). A box contents list is available in the repository; filed under Lieutenant Governor: Olson, Alec.

researchRecord.name: 1969-1975, 11 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Alec Gehard Olson include correspondence, bills, commission studies, and legislative materials from his service in the state senate. A finding aid for the papers is available in the repository.
